availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Duerson (Jessamine County, Kentucky, blacksmith and justice of the peace )

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, blacksmith and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Eusebian A. Frost Duerson. Father of Margaret A. Duerson Rice, Lucy C. Duerson, Susan E. Duerson, Mary T. Duerson, Martha Ellen Duerson, and Nancy M. Duerson. Blacksmith in Jessamine County, Kentucky, in 1850. Blacksmith in Jessamine County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Jessamine County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 66A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 133-34.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 6, p. 101A.
Kentucky Birth Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994042, Jessamine County Births, p. 2.
"Eusebian Duerson (1817-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99753378, accessed November 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99753378.
"John B. Duerson (1817-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #99753419, accessed November 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/99753419.
